required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Examining the Effect of Nutritional Supplementation on Skeletal Muscle Mass in Patients Awaiting Lung Transplant
clinical_study.official_title: A Pilot Study Examining the Effect of Nutritional Supplementation on Skeletal Muscle Mass in Patients Awaiting Lung Transplant

brief_summary.textblock: This non-randomized pilot study aims to investigate whether a protein rich nutritional shake (Ensure Enlive) given to patients pre-transplant will decrease skeletal muscle loss (measured by quadriceps ultrasound) and improve nutritional state (measured by Nutritional Risk Index). A nutritional supplement would be a cost-effective solution to treat malnutrition, a known risk factor implicated in poor outcomes for lung transplant recipients.

study_design_info.intervention_model_description: Ensure Enlive, Nutritional shake, twice a day

primary_outcome.measure: Effect of nutritional supplementation on skeletal muscle mass as assessed by ultrasound of the quadriceps
primary_outcome.description: To examine the effect of nutritional supplementation on skeletal muscle mass in patients with end stage lung disease who are awaiting lung transplant, measured by ultrasound of the quadriceps.

secondary_outcome.measure: Effect of nutritional supplementation on Nutritional Risk index as assessed by serum albumin level
secondary_outcome.description: To examine the effect of nutritional supplementation on Nutritional Risk index, measured by serum albumin level.

arm_group.description: Nutritional shakes, Ensure Enlive, twice per day orally in patients awaiting lung transplant

intervention.description: Ensure Enlive shake twice a day

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Subjects 18 years or older who are listed for single or double lung transplant
- Subject provides written informed consent to participate in this study
Exclusion Criteria:
- Subject with history of Galactosemia
- Subject with history of milk protein allergy
- Subject with history of soy protein allergy

link.description: Sarcopenia of the Psoas Muscles Is Associated With Poor Outcomes Following Lung Transplantation
Impact of nutritional state on lung transplant outcomes

reference.citation: Hsu J, Krishnan A, Lin CT, Shah PD, Broderick SR, Higgins RSD, Merlo CA, Bush EL. Sarcopenia of the Psoas Muscles Is Associated With Poor Outcomes Following Lung Transplantation. Ann Thorac Surg. 2019 Apr;107(4):1082-1088. doi: 10.1016/j.athoracsur.2018.10.006. Epub 2018 Nov 14.

Chamogeorgakis T, Mason DP, Murthy SC, Thuita L, Raymond DP, Pettersson GB, Blackstone EH. Impact of nutritional state on lung transplant outcomes. J Heart Lung Transplant. 2013 Jul;32(7):693-700. doi: 10.1016/j.healun.2013.04.005. Epub 2013 May 9.

patient_data.ipd_time_frame: Data will be available upon completion of the study analysis
